verses.plain: The words of Agur the son of Jakeh, even the prophecy: the man spake unto Ithiel, even unto Ithiel and Ucal,

tokens.t: The words of Agur the son of Jakeh,
the prophecy: the man spake unto Ithiel, even unto Ithiel and Ucal,

verses.plain: Surely I am more brutish than any man, and have not the understanding of a man.

tokens.t: man, and have not the understanding of a man.

verses.plain: I neither learned wisdom, nor have the knowledge of the holy.

tokens.t: I neither learned wisdom, nor have the knowledge of the holy.

verses.plain: Who hath ascended up into heaven, or descended? who hath gathered the wind in his fists? who hath bound the waters in a garment? who hath established all the ends of the earth? what is his name, and what is his son’s name, if thou canst tell?

tokens.t: Who hath ascended up into heaven, or descended? who hath gathered the wind in his fists? who hath bound the waters in a garment? who hath established all the ends of the earth? what
his son’s name, if thou canst tell?

verses.plain: Every word of God is pure: he is a shield unto them that put their trust in him.

tokens.t: a shield unto them that put their trust in him.

verses.plain: Add thou not unto his words, lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar.

tokens.t: Add thou not unto his words, lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar.

verses.plain: Two things have I required of thee; deny me them not before I die:

tokens.t: have I required of thee; deny me

verses.plain: Remove far from me vanity and lies: give me neither poverty nor riches; feed me with food convenient for me:

tokens.t: Remove far from me vanity and lies: give me neither poverty nor riches; feed me with food convenient for me:

verses.plain: Lest I be full, and deny thee, and say, Who is the LORD? or lest I be poor, and steal, and take the name of my God in vain.

tokens.t: Lest I be full, and deny
? or lest I be poor, and steal, and take the name of my God

verses.plain: Accuse not a servant unto his master, lest he curse thee, and thou be found guilty.

tokens.t: Accuse not a servant unto his master, lest he curse thee, and thou be found guilty.

verses.plain: There is a generation that curseth their father, and doth not bless their mother.

tokens.t: curseth their father, and doth not bless their mother.

verses.plain: There is a generation that are pure in their own eyes, and yet is not washed from their filthiness.

tokens.t: pure in their own eyes, and
is not washed from their filthiness.

verses.plain: There is a generation, O how lofty are their eyes! and their eyelids are lifted up.

tokens.t: a generation, O how lofty are their eyes! and their eyelids are lifted up.

verses.plain: There is a generation, whose teeth are as swords, and their jaw teeth as knives, to devour the poor from off the earth, and the needy from among men.

tokens.t: knives, to devour the poor from off the earth, and the needy from

verses.plain: The horseleach hath two daughters, crying, Give, give. There are three things that are never satisfied, yea, four things say not, It is enough:
The grave; and the barren womb; the earth that is not filled with water; and the fire that saith not, It is enough.

tokens.t: The grave; and the barren womb; the earth
is not filled with water; and the fire

verses.plain: The eye that mocketh at his father, and despiseth to obey his mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young eagles shall eat it.

tokens.t: mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young eagles shall eat it.

verses.plain: There be three things which are too wonderful for me, yea, four which I know not:

tokens.t: are too wonderful for me, yea, four which I know not:

verses.plain: The way of an eagle in the air; the way of a serpent upon a rock; the way of a ship in the midst of the sea; and the way of a man with a maid.

tokens.t: The way of an eagle in the air; the way of a serpent upon a rock; the way of a ship in the midst of the sea; and the way of a man with a maid.

verses.plain: Such is the way of an adulterous woman; she eateth, and wipeth her mouth, and saith, I have done no wickedness.

tokens.t: the way of an adulterous woman; she eateth, and wipeth her mouth, and saith, I have done no wickedness.

verses.plain: For three things the earth is disquieted, and for four which it cannot bear:

tokens.t: the earth is disquieted, and for four

verses.plain: For a servant when he reigneth; and a fool when he is filled with meat;

tokens.t: For a servant when he reigneth; and a fool when he is filled with meat;

verses.plain: For an odious woman when she is married; and an handmaid that is heir to her mistress.

tokens.t: when she is married; and an handmaid that is heir to her mistress.

verses.plain: There be four things which are little upon the earth, but they are exceeding wise:

tokens.t: little upon the earth, but they

verses.plain: The ants are a people not strong, yet they prepare their meat in the summer;

tokens.t: a people not strong, yet they prepare their meat in the summer;

verses.plain: The conies are but a feeble folk, yet make they their houses in the rocks;

tokens.t: a feeble folk, yet make they their houses in the rocks;

verses.plain: The locusts have no king, yet go they forth all of them by bands;

tokens.t: The locusts have no king, yet go they forth all of them by bands;

verses.plain: The spider taketh hold with her hands, and is in kings’ palaces.

tokens.t: The spider taketh hold with her hands, and is in kings’ palaces.

verses.plain: There be three things which go well, yea, four are comely in going:

tokens.t: which go well, yea, four are comely in going:

verses.plain: A lion which is strongest among beasts, and turneth not away for any;

tokens.t: strongest among beasts, and turneth not away for any;

verses.plain: A greyhound; an he goat also; and a king, against whom there is no rising up.

tokens.t: A greyhound; an he goat also; and a king, against whom

verses.plain: If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself, or if thou hast thought evil, lay thine hand upon thy mouth.

tokens.t: If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself, or if thou hast thought evil,

verses.plain: Surely the churning of milk bringeth forth butter, and the wringing of the nose bringeth forth blood: so the forcing of wrath bringeth forth strife.

tokens.t: Surely the churning of milk bringeth forth butter, and the wringing of the nose bringeth forth blood: so the forcing of wrath bringeth forth strife.

footnotes.text: deny…: Heb. withhold not from me
Accuse…: Heb. Hurt not with thy tongue
greyhound: or, horse: Heb. girt in the loins
